headline.main: Vindication for a Leading Proponent Of Theory 'People Are Born to Be Fat'

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: For Dr. Jules Hirsch, a professor at Rockefeller University in New York and a senior physician at the university's hospital, the new studies showing that fat people are biochemically different from thin people are a vindication of a view he has promoted for more than two decades.
docs.snippet: LEAD: For Dr. Jules Hirsch, a professor at Rockefeller University in New York and a senior physician at the university's hospital, the new studies showing that fat people are biochemically different from thin people are a vindication of a view he has...

headline.main: New Obesity Studies Indicate Metabolism Is Often to Blame

docs.lead_paragraph: LEAD: Two new studies have provided the strongest evidence yet that many people become obese more because their bodies burn calories too slowly than because they eat too much.
docs.snippet: LEAD: Two new studies have provided the strongest evidence yet that many people become obese more because their bodies burn calories too slowly than because they eat too much.
